title: Optimized multiple instance learning for brain tumor classification using weakly supervised contrastive learning
details: K Lu, S Lin, K Xue, D Huang, Y Ji - Computers in Biology and Medicine, 2025
abstract: Brain tumors have a great impact on patients' quality of life and accurate histopathological classification of brain tumors is crucial for patients' prognosis. Multi- instance learning (MIL) has become the mainstream method for analyzing whole …

title: DLSAC-Net: An automated enhanced segmentation and classification network for lung diseases detection using chest X-Ray images
details: P Bhardwaj, A Kaur - Multimedia Tools and Applications, 2025
abstract: Automated lung disease segmentation in Chest X-Ray images is vital in many clinical investigations, such as surgical assessment, planning and chronic disease diagnosis. Despite rapid advancements of fully automated approaches in the field of …
